summary: This is a July 5, 2020 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It requests the scheduling of an arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing for July 10, 2020, following Maxwell's arrest on July 2, 2020. The letter also seeks exclusions of time under the Speedy Trial Act and discusses the need for a protective order to protect victims' identities during discovery.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) who was arrested on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire, and is being transferred to the Southern District of New York for arraignment and bail hearing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell to whom this letter is addressed, requesting her to schedule proceedings.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell who was consulted regarding the scheduling of the arraignment and bail hearing and who consents to the Government's requests regarding time exclusions.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: An attorney copied on the letter, likely part of the defense or legal team.

connections.description: Christian Everdell is identified as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, representing her in the criminal case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is the presiding judge over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in Bradford, New Hampshire, on the charges contained in the indictment and presented before a U.S. Magistrate Judge in the District of New Hampshire.

events.title: Scheduled Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: The Government and defense counsel request the Court schedule an arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York.

locations: United States Courthouse, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The Government and defense counsel jointly requested a bail hearing and arraignment be scheduled for July 10, 2020, in the Southern District of New York.
The Government requested exclusions of time under the Speedy Trial Act, citing transportation and the need to discuss a protective order to protect victims' identities.
Defense counsel Christian Everdell consented to the Government's requests regarding scheduling and time exclusions.
The document highlights the immediate procedural steps following Maxwell's arrest and the focus on protecting victim privacy through a protective order.
